education.description: Financial Accounting is an 8-week, 60-hour online certificate program from Harvard Business School. This course teaches the fundamentals of financial accounting from the ground up. Participants learn how to prepare and interpret financial statements—the balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement—and calculate and interpret critical ratios. The course concludes with an introduction to forecasting and valuation. Financial Accounting was developed by leading Harvard Business School faculty and is delivered in an active learning environment based on the HBS signature case-based learning method. Show less

492435128.headline: Software Developer
492435128.summary: I'm a Toronto-based software developer, with a focus on web technologies. I have 10+ years of experience working with JavaScript web apps supported by Python API backends. My experience is not limited to just JavaScript and Python as I have experience in a range of languages and paradigms from Java-based desktop apps to passing EDI messages between businesses to financial calculations backends.

experience.description: Helped to build a financial web application for money managers encompassing the entire workflow from importing account transactions to rebalancing accounts / portfolios to graphing portfolio risk. » Built a risk level reporting system for money managers with the support of company’s financial engineers. » Worked on both the Python backend and the React front-end systems. » Built and maintained a system that capable of rebalancing 1000’s of financial accounts to match user specified parameters while taking into account various trading restrictions. » Built and maintained a system for managing trades and batches of trades to be sent to trading systems for execution including processing allocation on receipt of trades. » Maintained a system that managed transactions for all customer accounts and built them into various levels of reporting for both money managers and their clients. Show less

- Built an eCommerce platform allowing sales from 3rd party vendors from the ground up. - Built an inventory management system with specialization in tracking oral surgery supplies from scratch. - Built single page app administration system site admins and 3rd party vendors. - Built a custom PDF generation system for creating shelving labels. - Built vendor-faced administration system to manage stock. - Built custom reports to help customers manage inventory.

Software developer maintaining and extending legacy systems utilizing a variety of languages (e.g. C, Java, Perl, Python, Groovy) and technologies (e.g. Unify, Oracle, Postgres, Apache), as well as replacing legacy systems with web-based versions where necessary. Integrating competitor software obtained during a buyout. Creating small-scale data warehouse. Creating transaction processing application to interact with POS software. Maintaining legacy internal GUI apps (Java 1.3). Maintaining legacy terminal UI apps (in C). Show less

270531045.headline: Software Verification Specialist at AB SCIEX | PhD Analytical Chemist | Expert in Mass Spectrometry
270531045.summary: My research involves the study of covalent, non-covalent protein complexes, clinically important proteins and the structural changes that accompany their binding to drugs which are important for drug screening, design and delivery. Some of the studied proteins include therapeutic antibodies, antibiotic and cancer drug targets as well as proteomic assay of secreted proteins from human culture studies using analytical techniques like UV-VIS, HPLC and mass spectrometry. I have also worked on the synthesis of organic/inorganic compounds and their application in the surface study of protease inhibition using techniques like Infrared Spectroscopy (IR), Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) and other electrochemical techniques. I continue to improve my knowledge and research regularly, meeting up with industry experts and collaborating on research projects with scientist from Biotechnology, Biochemistry and Pharmaceutical companies. I can be contacted for further details about my work and expertise - dupesowole@gmail.com

experience.company_hq_full_address: 500 Old Connecticut Path; Framingham, MA 01701, US

experience.description: -Solid understanding of mass spectrometry (Synapt, Orbitrap, Agilent instruments, etc.) -Proficient in Analytical software - MassLynx, DynamX, PEAKS, Xcalibur, MaxQuant to mention a few -Experienced in the use of Ultra-performance and High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (UPLC and HPLC) instruments -Deep technical and hands-on experience in the use of mass spectrometry for biological samples and small molecules using LC/MS/MS - Knowledge of wet chemistry, analytical bench techniques -Able to troubleshoot, maintain laboratory instruments -Able to liaise with equipment engineers and train staff/customers when required -Possess good written and verbal communication skills -Proficient in Windows-based software like Windows, Excel, and Powerpoint Show less

-Conceived and developed novel analytical methods for the characterization of monoclonal antibodies -Identified pro-inflammatory and angiogenic proteins in human cell culture studies under different induction conditions -Experimental design and methodology -Isolated and cultured cells from human Adipose tissue -Isolated, separated and purified proteins from cell culture studies -Experienced in the use of Mass spectrometry (MS), High-performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) and SDS-PAGE for complex protein/peptide mixtures -Analyzed intact and digested antibody fragments using LC/MS, LC/MS/MS -Data analysis and record keeping skills -Experienced in troubleshooting and maintaining Instruments -Wrote technical reports with over 10 peer-reviewed publications -Presentation of scientific findings at conferences e.g. ASMS, CSC, CSN, etc Show less

821852555.headline: Working on Canada’s $3B Cernavoda Expansion Project | SWE @McMaster | PM @AtkinsRéalis | Prev. @FM-Engineering | Ambassador @Microsoft | Boardy Fellow | Growth @ Speechify | TA & Dean’s List Recipient
821852555.summary: I used to have a pretty standard "𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭" section that simply rehashed my job roles and experience... 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐬𝐧’𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭.... For me, the word that changes it all is 𝐏𝐀𝐒𝐒𝐈𝐎𝐍. I used to think that sounded cheesy—until I stopped overthinking, and started saying “yes” to more opportunities, and began to see what software can actually do for people. My “aha” moment wasn’t overnight. It came about slowly—through late nights, broken builds—and then... one unforgettable hackathon almost 2 years ago: I built a real-time computer vision AI navigation system for two of my closest blind friends. They Tried it. It worked. And then, it clicked for me: 𝐌𝐲 𝐦𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐥𝐞. 𝐈𝐭 𝐚𝐥𝐰𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐛𝐞𝐞𝐧, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐥𝐰𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐛𝐞. --------------------------------- 𝐉𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐒𝐮𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐫, 𝐈: ➤ PM on the Candu $3B nuclear refurbishment in Romania → worked on large enterprise AI Solutions ➤ Demoed and Spoke at conferences around the world, including Vancouver · San Francisco, · Dubai ➤ Gained 2M+ views / 8k+ followers sharing my career/life story. 𝐓𝐨𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐈’𝐦 𝐟𝐨𝐜𝐮𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧: ➤ Shipping AI-powered tools that help real humans, not hype ➤ Levelling up as a systems-minded, product-driven SWE. ➤ Exploring Summer 2026 SWE internships (AI/ML, iOS, backend, or CV). If anything you've read here interests you—𝐋𝐞𝐭’𝐬 𝐭𝐚𝐥𝐤! Let’s build for people. sammytourani@gmail.com

842149798.headline: Software Verification Specialist at AB SCIEX | PhD Analytical Chemist | Expert in Mass Spectrometry
842149798.summary: My research involves the study of covalent, non-covalent protein complexes, clinically important proteins and the structural changes that accompany their binding to drugs which are important for drug screening, design and delivery. Some of the studied proteins include therapeutic antibodies, antibiotic and cancer drug targets as well as proteomic assay of secreted proteins from human culture studies using analytical techniques like UV-VIS, HPLC and mass spectrometry. I have also worked on the synthesis of organic/inorganic compounds and their application in the surface study of protease inhibition using techniques like Infrared Spectroscopy (IR), Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) and other electrochemical techniques. I continue to improve my knowledge and research regularly, meeting up with industry experts and collaborating on research projects with scientist from Biotechnology, Biochemistry and Pharmaceutical companies. I can be contacted for further details about my work and expertise - dupesowole@gmail.com

519342139.summary: Graduated from B-Tech - Automotive and Vehicle Engineering Technology at McMaster University. I am looking to apply engineering principles used in the construction, operation, design, and manufacturing of modern internal combustion, plug-in hybrid, electric, and hydrogen fuel cell vehicles. I also aim to combine automotive knowledge with modern industrial design and manufacturing processes such as robotics and industry 5.0. As the program also dedicates 25% of courses to business, I am also competent with principals in management, economics, finance, marketing and accounting. The automotive industry is currently experiencing a tremendous amount of change making it an exciting time to study alternative and innovative ways to power vehicles. I have a passion for design and manufacturing. I am interested in using the skills I have developed in Solidworks, CATIA, and AutoCAD to design innovative and functional machine components and using those designs in the manufacturing process.

Created and updated work instructions for machines and automated robot cells to ensure safety compliance and eliminate ambiguity in machine operation for improved production. Updated plant floor layouts to accommodate the installation of new automation cells to optimize operations and part flow. Show less

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology - BTech Automotive Capstone Project, Automotive Engineering Technology/Technician, A
education.description: Designed and manufactured a suspension energy harvester. System functioned by receiving an input vibration frequency, then amplifying the signal by a mass and spring MCK system. The mechanical energy was converted to electrical energy via a generator comprised of neodymium radial and axial magnets. The output AC electrical signal was then rectified to a DC signal and regulated to a 14 volt DC output for storage. Primary focus was the power electronics and storage conceptualization and supporting in mechanical design, 3D printing, and manufacturing. This project was a proof of concept, where a concept was physically proven. Suspension energy harvester have been prototyped by large automotive companies but have never seen any mainstream production in consumer vehicles or motorsport. Show less

344082425.summary: An experienced leader with over 25 years of experience in the both repetitive and project based manufacturing industries. 344082425.active_experience_description: Wesco has been in business since 1954, providing trailers to the boating communities of North and South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Tennessee and Virginia. Their reputation for product excellence and strong performance in these markets is what lead to their acquisition by BarDak Group. The team at Wesco is awesome! Their excitement and energy to grow the brand both within and in new markets is fantastic. Working with this team to continue to grow the brand and improve the financial performance of the organization fills each day. For more information on our great product line, please go to www.wescotrailers.net Show less

BarDak works with select business partners and investors to improve shareholder value. Unlike traditional approaches, BarDak leverages its teams international network and skills learned in the trenches to identify solutions and leverage opportunities for growth and increased profitability. Visit www.bardak.ca for more information.

LSC Group (www.lscgroup.ca) was established in 1997 and has grown to become a leader in aluminum railing system design, engineering, manufacturing and installation for the residential high-rise condominium market. LSC is able to provide custom designed systems for North American customers from its facilities in Brampton, Ontario. As President, I worked to realign this organization - strengthening the team and methods used to bring projects back on schedule and increase profitability. I worked with Allan Windows (LSC Group's parent company) for 3 years providing guidance on Sales, Marketing and Operations prior to assuming the role of President at LSC. Show less

Single Source Technologies is a Distributor of Industrial Machine Tools for the Canadian marketplace. SST provides sales, parts, service, and applications engineering support to Makino (Milling and EDM), as well as Fives - Cinetic (Landis Grinding) and Muratec (automated twin spindle lathes). SST works closely with customers to help them apply technology solutions in their businesses to compete in the global economy.
Hallmark Technology was a mold manufacturer in Windsor, Ontario, supporting injection molders in the automotive parts manufacturing segment.

Growth Technology was my consulting group that I was the principal for 7 years. Growth Technology supported manufacturers in the automotive and durable goods segments in Canada, USA, Mexico, Korea, Italy and the UK. Our primary focus was Lean Manufacturing and Program Management.
Peregrine Automotive was a producer of components for the automotive market. It was made up of components of Delphi that were severed off in late 1996.

I spent 6 years at Magna in three positions - Business Systems Manager at Magna Corporate, Plant Manager at SlideMaster, and as a Director at Atoma. Magna is the largest auto parts manufacturer in Canada.

As a supplier development engineer with General Motors, we were challenged to support our supply base with identification and implementation of cost down opportunities using Lean Manufacturing fundamentals.

publications_topics: Regionally defined proteomic profiles of human cerebral tissue and organoids reveal conserved molecular modules of neurodevelopment
HAVOC: Small-scale histomic mapping of biodiversity across entire tumor specimens using deep neural networks

publications.title: Regionally defined proteomic profiles of human cerebral tissue and organoids reveal conserved molecular modules of neurodevelopment
publications.description: Cerebral organoids have emerged as robust models for neurodevelopmental and pathological processes, as well as a powerful discovery platform for less-characterized neurobiological programs. Toward this prospect, we leverage mass-spectrometry-based proteomics to molecularly profile precursor and neuronal compartments of both human-derived organoids and mid-gestation fetal brain tissue to define overlapping programs. Our analysis includes recovery of precursor-enriched transcriptional regulatory proteins not found to be differentially expressed in previous transcriptomic datasets. To highlight the discovery potential of this resource, we show that RUVBL2 is preferentially expressed in the SOX2-positive compartment of organoids and that chemical inactivation leads to precursor cell displacement and apoptosis. To explore clinicopathological correlates of this cytoarchitectural disruption, we interrogate clinical datasets and identify rare de novo genetic variants involving RUVBL2 in patients with neurodevelopmental impairments. Together, our findings demonstrate how cell-type-specific profiling of organoids can help nominate previously unappreciated genes in neurodevelopment and disease. Show less

publications.title: HAVOC: Small-scale histomic mapping of biodiversity across entire tumor specimens using deep neural networks
publications.description: Intra-tumoral heterogeneity can wreak havoc on current precision medicine strategies due to challenges in sufficient sampling of geographically separated areas of biodiversity distributed across centimeter-scale tumor distances. In particular, modern tissue profiling approaches are still largely designed to only interrogate small tumor fragments; which may constitute a minute and non-representative fraction of the overall neoplasm. To address this gap, we developed a pipeline that leverages deep learning to define topographic histomorphologic fingerprints of tissue and create Histomic Atlases of Variation Of Cancers (HAVOC). Importantly, using a number of spatially-resolved readouts, including mass-spectrometry-based proteomics and immunohistochemisy, we demonstrate that these personalized atlases of histomic variation can define regional cancer boundaries with distinct biological programs. Using larger tumor specimens, we show that HAVOC can map spatial organization of cancer biodiversity spanning tissue coordinates separated by multiple centimeters. By applying this tool to guide profiling of 19 distinct geographic partitions from 6 high-grade gliomas, HAVOC revealed that distinct states of differentiation can often co-exist and be regionally distributed across individual tumors. Finally, to highlight generalizability, we further benchmark HAVOC on additional tumor types and experimental models of heterogeneity. Together, we establish HAVOC as a versatile and accessible tool to generate small-scale maps of tissue heterogeneity and guide regional deployment of molecular resources to relevant and biodiverse tumor niches. Show less

512256014.active_experience_description: I have been working in Synaptive Medical Inc. as a Junior Software Developer (DevOps) since 2022-06-27. I am part of the DevOps team which is part of the MRI Software team. I generally work on developing the build, deployment and upgrade processes. I also work on some parts of the software used in the MRI machine. Our team does DevOps with a Software Developer approach, as in we use existing DevOps tools and pipelines such as TeamCity but we also have our own tools and pipelines that we develop and use. As part of my work at Synaptive Medical, I fully automated the installation of Windows 10 to customer systems using PowerShell, WSIM and Ansible. As a result, the upgrade process was greatly simplified. Which saved the company time and money by reducing the amount of service time needed per upgrade. It also reduced the risk of human errors by fully automating the process and reduced the down time for the customers. I greatly contributed to the creation of an upgrade framework that enabled us to create upgrade packages for our customers in a fast-paced manner. This allowed us to release 3 software releases in a year compared to 1 software release in 2 years. Show less

116970269.headline: Principal, MDM Architecture - Data & Analytics at LTIMindtree
116970269.summary: Okafor has built a distinguished 18-year career in the IT industry, characterized by his unwavering commitment to technical excellence and leadership. His professional journey encompasses pivotal roles such as Senior Database Administrator, Unix/Linux System Administrator, Data Warehouse Solution Designer, Big Data Solution Advisor, IBM Technical Sales Specialist, Advanced Customer Engineer with Informatica, Manager, Data Architect with Deloitte Omnia AI Practice, Manager, Tech Data Management with Accenture Data & AI Practice, and most recently, Lead Principal MDM Architect with LTIMintree Data & Analytics Practice. Renowned for his expertise and technical acumen in Master Data Management, Core Databases, Big Data Solutions, Data Integration (ETL), Data Governance, Customer Data Platform, and Cloud Platforms. Okafor's reputation as a technical expert and leader extends beyond workplaces. Over the years, he has presented at dozens of conferences and training sessions worldwide, where he has lectured on various topics including Core Databases, Data Integration and Governance, MDM, and Cloud technologies. He continues to volunteer and serves as a Mentor/Coach at the Vector Institute I. M. P. A. C. T. Mentorship Program and Black & Indigenous Students Program in Canada. In his role as a Senior DBA, Okafor spearheaded the deployment and management of enterprise-grade databases for esteemed clients such as Nigerian Customs and Unified Payments Services Nigeria, a prominent payment card company. His tenure as an IBM Client Technical Specialist solidified his reputation as a subject matter expert for Db2 and related technologies and MDM within IBM MEA. During his tenure as a Senior Customer Engineer with Informatica, Okafor played a pivotal role in driving Informatica MDMSaaS and Customer 360 Insight, as well as fostering the Informatica Business Partner ecosystem through mentoring, advocacy, and delivery of technical accelerators like POCs and technical enablement. As Manager, Data Architect with Deloitte Omnia AI Practice, and subsequently Manager, Tech Data Management with Accenture Data & AI Practice, Okafor led and managed a high-performance team tasked with architecting top-tier Data Analytics Platforms tailored to meet clients' diverse requirements. Currently, as the Lead Principal MDM Architect at LTIMindtree Canada Data & Analytics Practice, Okafor is entrusted with leading the strategic design and delivery of modern data management and analytics solutions that drive business transformation and ensure regulatory compliance.
116970269.active_experience_description: As the Lead Principal MDM Architect at LTIMindtree Canada, I lead the strategic design and delivery of modern data management and analytics solutions that drive business transformation and ensure regulatory compliance. With a strong focus on enterprise-scale data governance and modern MDM implementation, I enable organizations to unlock the full value of their data. I oversee complex data integration, migration, and modernization initiatives, aligning data platforms with business goals to deliver measurable outcomes in performance, risk management, and operational efficiency. A trusted advisor to senior leadership, I bridge business and technology teams to build scalable, future-ready data ecosystems that support innovation and competitive advantage.

761316412.headline: Automotive Computer Vision SW Engineer Intern @Qualcomm
761316412.summary: I am a third-year Computer Engineering student at the University of Toronto, driven by a desire to make a positive impact on the world through technology and entrepreneurship. I am highly self-motivated, excelling at independently researching and learning new topics and technologies. I have gained valuable experience working at the Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI), one of Taiwan's largest research institutions and the birthplace of TSMC, founded by Mr. Morris Chang. I was also an active member of the Formula Racing Driverless Team at my university, where I focused on state estimation for autonomous vehicles. Currently, I’m fully dedicated to my startup, UniLink | Campus Connect, where we aim to enhance the social lives of university students by improving how they connect on campus, with the University of Toronto as our pilot school. My skill set spans software development, operating systems, machine learning, and hardware development, refined through various projects and work experience. With an entrepreneurial mindset, I’m constantly seeking ways to merge my diverse interests—including software development, AI, computer networks, and hardware—to create innovative solutions that contribute to a better world.

630389375.headline: Reliability | Maintenance |  Continuous Improvement
630389375.summary: I believe that by providing practical, applied training as well as providing guidance on fostering a culture of reliability, that all facilities can optimize maintenance and operational spending. I am an experienced mechanical engineer with 12+ years experience in design, maintenance and reliability and have been fortunate enough to work in multiple industries, both in Canada and overseas. Throughout my career I've become acutely aware of the typical stumbling blocks when developing a reliability program and how to address these issues, particularly for small businesses. Talk to me about Maintenance or Reliability - let's connect on LinkedIn. Capabilities: Bad Actors Programs, CMMS, Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA), RCFA training, RCFA facilitation, failure investigation, mechanical design, reliability consulting, business process optimization, schedule optimization, pipeline design, pressure vessel design, P.Eng., MBA

projects.name: IoTerra: Internet of Things Smart Planting Solution
projects.description: 🌎↔️🌐 IoTerra is connecting our physical Earth to the power of the Internet. Click the link to see the current state of the project. The end goal is to make a ruggedized, weather-protected solution that can be set in a garden or farm alongside plants to provide real-time data about the soil moisture and weather data to control a watering system. The idea stands as a prototype for water conservation in large-scale agriculture, as moisture levels could be maintained and monitored remotely, giving a visual overview of the status of crop locations, and tapping into predictive analytics using future precipitation projections to determine when water can be conserved. Show less

projects.name: Pacemaker Software Development (SWFRENG 3K04)
projects.description: As part of this project, our team of five has developed a full software suite, adhering to design requirements for an actual pacemaker model that was developed in the 1990s, along with following best practices for software development to ensure safety in this safety-critical software, including design principles such as information hiding (through encapsulation). We have implemented: 1) Pacemaker Logic (MATLAB Simulink) - to send correct electrical pulses to sense and pace the heart, and adjust pacing frequency based on the current heart rate, while maintaining that critical timing has been ensured 2) A Front-End Application (Python) - to provide a GUI interface for medical professionals to enter desired parameters for their patient - to view a live-updating graphical representation of the electrical current in the heart (electrocardiogram) 3) Serial Communication (MATLAB Simulink & Python) - to interface between the front-end application with the pacemaker logic using UART - allowing sending pacemaker parameters from application to pacemaker, and receiving a real-time view of electrical current in the heart from pacemaker to application Show less

projects.name: Engineering Graphics and Design (ENG 1C03): Complete fabrication of mechanical hand prosthesis
projects.description: Our team was tasked with undergoing the holistic engineering process of a mechanical hand prosthesis. This meant starting off with initial hand calculations and sketches that considered both the desired gear ratio and spatial requirements of the project, then modelling and simulating the assembly using Autodesk Inventor software and creating engineering drawings for each component, finally 3D printing the components and performing the physical assembly of the parts. The process was extremely humbling in the fact that undergoing the entirety of the engineering process provides a great deal of respect to each of the aspects of it. Things such as accounting for the print time of our components were essential due to the fact that our print time was a limiting constraint outlined in the project. Another thing that we hadn't considered until assembly was that there was a fairly large degree of imprecision from the provided printer, so we had to make use of external power tools to ensure all gear teeth could mesh. These are two of the various things that I would have never considered had I not undergone this process, and therefore it was an incredibly valuable experience as an introduction to engineering. Show less

projects.name: Engineering Profession and Practice 1P03 Final Design Project: The HandyStand universal hands-free phone usage solution
projects.description: The aim of the project was to increase the quality of living of a client in the local Hamilton region, living with cerebral palsy and spastic quadriplegia, meaning that they have very limited strength, dexterity and range of motion. My role in the project was Project Coordinator, meaning that on the surface, I was responsible for organizing group meetings, delegating roles and tasks, maintaining accountability and overseeing all aspects of the project. However, the role went deeper in the sense that I took it as my personal responsibility to maximize the utility of all members, and I achieved this by aiming to set an example in myself. The product we created was designed in order to allow our client to maintain a sense of privacy and dignity in allowing them to converse on their landline phone without the use of speakerphone or a personal support worker present. For our design, we focused on simplicity, but there are multiple elements of the design that have implicit, clever intentions. We achieved our goals by creating the HandyStand, as it allows the user to simply have a personal support worker mount the device to the client's wheelchair, place the phone in the flexible grips at the end and then manipulate it into the desired position, thus allowing the client to have phone conversations without any workers being able to hear. If you have any questions, comments or general feedback on our design, feel free to message me on LinkedIn to talk about any aspects, including my role in the project, the final design, or the project, itself. Show less

patents.title: A Novel Flame Retardant Synergist- N-alkoxy Hindered Amine Containing Silane and Its Synthetic Method
patents.description: The invention discloses a siliceous N-substituted alkyloxy hindered amine compound and its preparation method, wherein the constitutional unit of the compound is shown in the formula I. In the formula I, X is the element O or a group R, three Xs are element O, one X is the group R, the structural formula of the group R is shown in the formula II. In the formula II, the general formula of R1 is -HN(CH2CH2NH)n(CH2)3-, n is 0-2; R2 is an alkyl group, the general formula of which is -CmH2m+1, wherein m is1-8; R3 is an alkyl group, the general formula of which is -CkH2k-, wherein k is 1-6; R4 and R5 respectively represent an alkyl group, of which the general formula is -CiH2i+1 or a cycloalkyl group, of which the general formula is -CtH2t, wherein i is 1-8 and t is 1-8. The compound simultaneously has flame-retardation synergy, light stability and compatibilization, can be used to raise flame retardation of a flame-retardation polymer and simultaneously further improve its light stability, mechanical property and the like. Show less

publications.title: Recovery behaviour of shape memory polyurethane based laminates after thermoforming
publications.description: Shape memory polymers (SMPs) can be used to produce a new class of decorative films capable of improved formability and shape recovery in polymer laminates, which are increasingly being used for automotive, aerospace, construction and commercial applications. As a relatively new field there is little knowledge on the shape recovery behaviour of laminates with a SMP film and few methods of quantify that behaviour. The influences of different variables that affect the recovery behaviour of thermoplastic shape memory polyurethanes based laminates including ambient temperature (45 °C and 65 °C), material modulus, and adhesive strength were investigated after thermoforming, through both experimental and modelling methods. The empirical model assisted in identifying the contributions of the adhesive to transfer stresses, which dampened the recovery of the laminate with lower shear strength adhesives. Increasing ambient temperature and the film modulus increased both the final angle recovery ratios and recovery rates. Show less

publications.title: Evaluating shape memory behavior of polymer under deep-drawing conditions
publications.description: Thermoplastic polyurethanes (TPU) are a popular family of shape memory polymers (SMP) due to their excellent abrasion & weather resistant, and mechanical strength. However, conventional processing operations or their combination with other polymers by adhesion or blending can affect their unique shape memory behavior. Currently, there are no effective methods to study and quantify the shape memory behavior of SMP based polymer laminates as they would respond to deep drawing operations. In this paper, a new method was introduced to effectively quantify the recovery behavior of TPU based polymer laminates undergoing simultaneous stretching and bending operations at different processing temperatures. The results presented show the value of developing a shape recovery characterization method that resembles the stresses of thermoforming to properly assess formability of shape memory polymers used in laminate constructions. Show less

publications.title: Automated image analysis to characterize the melt densification stage of polymer sintering processes
publications.description: Knowledge of melt densification during sintering is generally acquired by visualization methods, recording bubble formation and dissolution with time. Only manual visualization methods have been reported for polymer studies, which restrict the availability of data to a few discrete moments in time for the overall process. An automated vision system is presented in this paper to provide an improved level of analysis on densification, validated against a manual method. The machine vision technique was applied in the analysis of sintering for various polyethylenes of differing melt flow index and particle size. The automated technique was found to be very accurate and capable of collecting bubble size distributions on a timescale of seconds, which is an improvement in data collection. The method was prone to underestimate bubble numbers (∼20% error), especially those less than 100 μm in size, till the bed temperature rose significantly above the melting temperature of the polymer. Show less
publisher_names: Elizabeth Soos Takacs, MSc, DCHM, Hom

publications.title: Synthesis of N-alkoxy Hindered Amine Containing Silane As a Multifunctional Flame Retardant Synergist and Its Application in Intumescent Flame Retardant Polypropylene
publications.description: A novel and multifunctional flame retardant synergist, N-alkoxy hindered amine containing silane (Si-NORs), was synthesized by combining N-alkoxy hindered amine and silane coupling together through sol–gel reaction. The composition of Si-NORs was characterized by FTIR and XPS. Intumescent flame retardant polypropylene (IFR–PP) composites were prepared with different contents of Si-NOR and characterized by the limiting oxygen index (LOI), vertical burning tests (UL-94 tests), TGA, the Yellowness Index (YI), mechanical properties, and SEM measurements. The results showed that IFR–PP composites with 1 wt % Si-NORs and 25 wt % intumescent flame retardant could reach a V-0 rating in the UL-94 tests. Moreover, the thermal stability, UV stability, mechanical properties, compatibility, and char residue structure were also improved significantly, which proves Si-NOR as a multifunctional flame retardant synergist. The possible synergistic mechanism of Si-NORs was also discussed. Show less

publications.title: Kinetic Study on Surface Modification of Ammonium Polyphosphate with Melamine
publications.description: Ammonium polyphosphate (APP) and melamine (MEL) are two typical components of halogen-free intumescent flame retardants. Surface modification of APP with MEL is one solution to overcome the weak water resistance and low compatibility with polymeric materials of APP, in addition to adjusting the ratio between phosphorus and nitrogen elements. This work is focused on the kinetics of the reaction between APP and MEL. The amount of ammonia released during reaction, the grafting ratio, and the grafting efficiency were determined by elemental analysis and FTIR spectroscopy. A kinetics model was developed to quantify the reaction process. The kinetic parameters were estimated from the experimental data. It was found that the apparent reaction orders with respect to APP and MEL are 1 and 2, respectively. The frequency factor and activation energy of this reaction were determined to be 9.29 × 104 s–1 and 75.9 kJ/mol. Simulation results obtained by this model fit the experimental data well. Show less

publications.title: Flame Retardant Based on N-Alkoxyoxy Hindered Amines and Their Application in Polyolefins
publications.description: Hindered amines have been used as UV stabilizers for a long period. The recent attempt to improve the properties of hindered amines revealed that the N-alkoxyoxy hindered amines(NORs) poss excellent flame retardancy. In this article, the chemical structure, properties, synthesis methods, flame-retardant mechanism of NORs and their application in polyolefins are systematically reviewed. NORs are synthesized through the reaction of 2,2,6,6-tetramethylpiperidine derivatives with alkyl radicals in several steps with the presence of catalysts. The mechanism of NORs as flame retardant(FR) in polyolefins is generally based on the thermolysis of NORs that leads to the formation of efficient and regenerable free radical scavengers. NORs are involved in the free radical chemical reactions during the combustion process and reduce the free radicals concentration by converting them into alcohols and ketones that are relatively stable. Furthermore, NORs can interact with conventional brominated or phosphorus-based FR through radical reactions in the condensed phase, resulting in improved FR efficiency. Researches indicate that NORs provide excellent FR performance for thin polyolefin section such as fibers and films at unexpected low concentration. The loading as low as 0.5wt% can result in satisfied flame retardancy. Moreover, they have a good synergistic effect in combination with conventional FR to improve their efficiency, so the loading of conventional FR can be significantly decreased. Additionally, NORs also provide polyolefin with excellent UV stability and long-term thermal stability. Show less

publications.title: Preparation and Characterization of High Melt Strength Polypropylene with Long Chain Branched Structure by the Reactive Extrusion Process
publications.description: The reactive extrusion of maleic anhydride grafted polypropylene (PP-g-MAH) with ethylenediamine (EDA) as coupling agent is carried out in a corotating twin-screw extruder to produce long chain branched polypropylene (LCBPP). Part of PP-g-MAH is replaced by maleic anhydride grafted high-density polyethylene (HDPE-g-MAH) or linear low-density polyethylene (LLDPE-g-MAH) to obtain hybrid long chain branched (LCB) polyolefins. Compared with the PP-g-MAH, PE-g-MAH, and their blends, the LCB polyolefins exhibit excellent dynamic shear and transient extensional rheological characteristics such as increased dynamic modulus, higher low-frequency complex viscosity, broader relaxation spectra, significantly enhanced melt strength and strain-hardening behaviors. The LCB polyolefins also have higher tensile strength, tensile modulus, impact strength and lower elongation at break than their blends. Furthermore, supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO2) is constructively introduced in the reactive extrusion process. In the presence of scCO2, the motor current of the twin extruder is decreased and LCB polyolefins with lower melt flow rate (MFR), higher complex viscosity and increased tensile strength and modulus can be obtained. This indicates that the application of scCO2 can reduce the viscosity of melt in extruder, enhance the diffusion of reactive species, and then facilitate the long chain branching reaction between anhydride group and primary amine group. Show less

publications_topics: Energy Efficiency Analysis of Centralized-Synchronous LoRa-based MAC Protocols
A MAC Protocol For Harsh Industrial IoT Applications

publications.title: Energy Efficiency Analysis of Centralized-Synchronous LoRa-based MAC Protocols
publications.description: LoRa is a PHY layer technology that has been gaining popularity with IoT platfrom developers, due to its low-power long-range communication. As a result, different classes of LoRabased MAC layer protocols have been proposed, with the key ones being either contention-based or centralized-synchronous. Since most of the research literature focused on analyzing the efficiency of contention-based LoRa protocols, we sought to study the efficiency of centralized-synchronous protocols. We utilized a tailored simulator to analyze the energy efficiency of LoRa-based centralized-synchronous protocols. Our findings, are backed up by hardware performance measurements. After comparing the energy efficiency of the centralized-synchronous protocols against that of other LoRa-based MAC layer protocol classes, we found that the lifetime of a device using a centralized-synchronous protocol was up to four times longer than that of a contentionbased device. These findings, as well as our insights, will aid the development of future energy-efficient LoRa-based MAC protocols. Show less

publications.title: A MAC Protocol For Harsh Industrial IoT Applications
publications.description: Heavy industries such as mining, constructions and transportation manufacturing are currently facing many dilemmas due to the critical and harsh conditions that they collide with during their operations. Such environments faces many challenges in managing the wireless communication due to the heavy equipment, large machine and wide areas that might cause failures in such systems. Thus, there is a great need for solutions to overcome those critical issues. We introduce single channel-MoT (SC-MoT) Medium Access Control (MAC) protocol that runs on top of LoRa physical layer. The protocol adapts the multiple channel protocol MoT for industrial applications enabling ease of implementation and lower cost and delay. SC-MoT uses LoRa modulation to offer an extended range of communication with high sensitivity and low noise. Similar to MoT, SC-MoT uses the centralized scheduling technique to achieve collision-free transmissions with low delays and long power source lifetime. In addition, features such as broadcasting and rapid acknowledging are also implemented in SC-MoT. We evaluate SC-MoT against MoT with respect to waiting times, energy consumption and cost. We also show results from field experiments in a harsh Industrial environment. Show less

projects.name: Kibana dashboards Automation testing
projects.description: We were able to complete 100% automation for 3 different dashboards on Kibana. The automation focused on validating two parts - Verify the data/graphs appears successfully on the dashboard and matches the data on elastic for the same elastic index - Complete data validation for all metrics by comparing it with the different sources. Technologies and programming languages : Java, Selenium, JSCH, Eclipse, Kibana, Logstash, elastic, CM, JupyterHub.

projects.name: Automating Jupyter Notebooks in JupyterHub
projects.description: The Target was to automate the QA functional test cases to validate all the functionality of the JupyterHub which includes but not limited to: 1- Testing the different interactions with the Jupyter hub such as (login, logout, Run cells, restart cells, shutdown kernels, etc) 2- Verify all the containers options and verify they are running as expected 3- Verify the ability to start new kernel and run all cells 4- Verify the ability to open pre-saved notebooks and run all cells 5- Verify the terminal functionality. We achieved ~90% automation coverage for all test cases using the following tools (Jenkins, Java, Selenium, BDD Cucumber) Our work helped in reducing the testing execution to only 5 days. Besides, it is reusable for different deployment in the future. Show less

projects.name: Automation Testing for Trifacta UI
projects.description: Working with different teams we were able successfully to automate 100% of the test cases and different use cases for TRIFACTA UI which is used for data wrangling and data transformation. Technologies and tools used: JAVA, Selenium, Cucumber, Autoit, JSCH, eclipse IDE.

projects.name: Automation in Citrix Environment
projects.description: The goal of the project is to automate the different use cases for multiple applications installed on Citrix storeFront. We successfully automated ~70% of use/test cases inside Citrix environment web interface privileging Java, Selenium, Autoit and BDD Cucumber.

projects.name: Automation testing for Cloudera Navigator HDFS Data Encryption

454193028.headline: Cyber Security Engineer @ K2E | Queen's University Mathematics and Engineering Graduate
454193028.summary: Driven by my passion for computers and mathematics, I exhibit a goal-driven work ethic that helps me complete tasks vigilantly and effectively. My current and previous employers can speak to my ability to learn quickly; in new positions, I quickly pick up on tendencies seen in exemplary employees which helps progress my proficiency in job-related activities. My experiences as both a front-end developer with QMIND AI and back-end developer with Distributive have helped me gain a solid understanding of the principles involved in end-to-end system design. I pride myself in my ability to both understand and implement design concepts that lead to holistic object classes, emergent behavior and painless debugging. Dealing with two different web frameworks, I honed my ability to self-motivate my learning and pick up new concepts through my simultaneous self-teaching of both NodeJS and ReactJS. As an individual, my ability to approach a problem from several different avenues in order to reach the best solution is the backbone behind my desire to design atomic systems. It is my belief that computer scientists should spend a significant proportion of their time planning their code when compared to time taken to implement it. For problem-solving, I am able to break down tasks well such that there is a good separation of concerns. This helps me make any problem, regardless of difficulty, manageable. Please reach out if you would like to connect.

252550119.headline: Lead Solution Engineer | Military Reservist | Previous Career as Healthcare Professional
252550119.summary: Leveraging a Master's Degree in Systems Leadership and Administration from the University of Toronto, I am currently a Lead Account Solution Engineer with Salesforce and a part-time manager in a medical unit with the Canadian Armed Forces. I bridge the gap between technology and customer success, blending the excitement of innovation with the precision of technical expertise. I craft and deliver Salesforce solutions for government clients with a deep, personal commitment to their success, driven by my own experiences working in healthcare as a Registered Nurse and working as a deployed medic within the Canadian Armed Forces. I am dedicated to leading our clients through the intricacies of digital transformation, focusing not just on simple digitization but advancing towards smart workflow automation and fostering engagement that puts people first. My role involves assisting government clients in reshaping their enterprise work processes and maximizing the potential of their data, systems, and workforce, extending across various business sectors and surpassing traditional IT boundaries.
252550119.active_experience_description: Contributes to significant revenue growth by collaborating with Salesforce teams and Government customers to enhance service delivery in Canada Leads a detailed analysis of business operations for government customers, focusing on strategic, financial, and service delivery factors to promote digital transformation Executes in-depth customer discovery assessments and workshops, revealing essential business, budgetary, and technical insights to support sales teams in understanding government customer requirements. Works closely with sales teams, specialists, and product lines within the Public Sector to enhance vertical integration, targeted customer use case identification, and strategic account management, aiming for technical success and advancement of key opportunities. Empowers account executives, broader sales teams, and partner technical groups with essential knowledge in specialized solution areas, enabling them to spot opportunities and effectively position Salesforce's platform in sales discussions. Involved in planning regional marketing events, such as user conferences, trade shows, webinars, and group meetings, to bolster brand presence and engagement. Personal background in government instills a profound understanding of the critical nature of robust cloud systems in operational effectiveness, fueling my dedication to ensuring each customer receives the most effective and efficient solution to meet their unique needs and missions. Show less

publications_topics: Algorithm to select a lead car in a Car Platoon

publications.title: Algorithm to select a lead car in a Car Platoon
publications.description: This novel algorithm describes a method (See "System requirements for Car Movement Control System (1-10)") to improve traffic by selecting a lead car in a Car Platoon when traffic occurs. This is a simple algorithm to organize random moving cars into Car Platoons in which the lead cars are selected automatically when traffic jam occurs. This algorithm can cover all the road scenarios and select a new lead car quickly when situations are changed. It provides a new method that is different from SARTRE project (http://www.sartre-project.eu/) in which the lead vehicle is fixed. The patent application was rejected for the following reasons: 1) I tried to patent an algorithm without sufficient description of the hardware. 2) The Car Platooning technology is a known technology (At the time of filing this invention I was not aware of the existence of the Car Platooning technology. So I claimed it in addition to the algorithm to select the lead car.) But I believe the proposed algorithm to select the lead car is still a unique algorithm that has not been published yet. Show less

projects_topics: TO STABILIZE THE CLAYED SOIL USING SUGARCANE  BAGGAGE ASH AND CEMENT MIX

projects.name: TO STABILIZE THE CLAYED SOIL USING SUGARCANE  BAGGAGE ASH AND CEMENT MIX
projects.description: Soil is the foundation material which supports loads from the overlying structure. Soil is the most widely used material on the highway, either in its natural form or processed form. Also, all the pavement structure lies on the soil. The construction cost can be widely decreased by selecting local materials, including local soils, for the construction of the lower layers of the pavement, such as the sub-base course. The formation of undulations, corrugations, up having, and rutting is generally attributed to poor subgrade conditions. This soil was classified as CI as per Indian Standard Classification System (ISCS). Different dosages of Sugarcane Baggage ash, i.e. 5%, 10% and 15% were used to stabilize the expansive soil. Sugarcane baggage ash was evaluated using physical and strength performance tests, namely, Grain size distribution, specific gravity, standard proctor test and unconfined undrainage test. These tests were conducted to evaluate the improvement in strength characteristics of the subgrade soil. Hence, using these such advanced materials in road construction can improve the strength of the soil and, in turn, reduce the project cost. From the result, it was observed that the necessary tests carried out proved significant after the addition of baggage ash. Show less

projects.name: ROS2 Simulated Multi-Agent Object Avoidance
projects.description: Currently developing a ROS2 node system to autonomously detect and avoid obstacles in the paths of simulated Turtlebot3 agents in Gazebo. Project Goal: To create a navigation stack which can effectively rate path difficulty across a fixed obstacle map and communicate with other Turtlebot3 agents for optimal swarm traversal.

projects.name: Haptic Feedback for Grip Control on Robotic Arm
projects.description: Integrated an 8bitdo controller (with vibration feedback) into a prefab robotic arm. Optimized python drivers for ultrasonic sensors to enable distance control of the end-effector, and trigger dynamic haptic feedback to the operator’s hands. The closer the end-effector is to an object/target the higher the vibrational feedback. Implemented grip control by creating a feedback loop that dynamically slows the speed of the end-effector clamp based on live ultrasonic sensor readings of proximity to objects. Show less

projects.name: Generalized Fisher's Linear Discriminant: Class-Aware Dimensionality Reduction Applied to Facial Recognition
projects.description: Thesis Project at Queen's University, supervised by Dr. Abdol-Reza Mansouri. Worked in a team of 7 students to research improvements upon classic facial recognition techniques. Optimized facial recognition for retirement communities through dimensionality reduction via generalized fisherface techniques. The code generated a 10% increase in accuracy compared to the classic eigenface method when testing on the 'Labelled Faces in the Wild' dataset.

projects.name: Classifying Unknown Control Systems and applying PID to achieve Nyquist Stability
projects.description: Worked in a team of 5 students using mathematical models (Bode Plots, Nyquist Plots, etc) to analyze and create an estimated model equation for a black box system. Then the team was required to create/tune a PID for the estimated model, the resultant controller was then applied to the black box system to evaluate the quality of estimation. Our team was within tolerable ranges for all tuned control characteristics and achieved Nyquist stability.

projects.name: Optimizing UAV Area Coverage using Lloyd's Deployment Algorithms
projects.description: In a small team of 4 we leveraged Lloyd's deployment algorithms to optimize area coverage for N-agents given a density matrix with areas of high-interest weighed more heavily. Proposed application was for multi-drone analysis in recon and search & rescue operations, as areas of interest are known prior to deployment.

83957659.summary: I started my career in Capital Markets, evolving from technical support and product training into product management—before pivoting into enterprise learning and development. With 15+ years of experience, I specialize in instructional design (ADDIE), blended and eLearning programs, learning analytics (Power BI, LMS dashboards), and enterprise platforms like MindTickle, Allego, and LinkedIn Learning. I’m passionate about building learning cultures that align with business goals—trusted by senior leaders as a strategic partner in talent development and organizational growth.

I’ve led initiatives that improved developer productivity, reduced review times by over 90%, and integrated AI-assisted solutions to scale support and operations. My skill set includes backend development, scripting, release management, API development, and CI/CD automation, along with hands-on involvement in agile team environments where iteration, ownership, and user-focused problem-solving were central. I’m passionate about building reliable systems, optimizing workflows, and driving collaboration between engineering, product, and operations teams. I’m currently exploring opportunities where I can continue to contribute to software development while also growing into technical project or product management roles that bridge strategy with execution.

patents.title: MULTIDIRECTIONAL WHEEL
patents.description: Provisional Patent detailing plans for a series of spherical tires allowing for omni-directional movement. I successfully prototyped one version of the spherical tire through 3D printing and traditional manufacturing methods. The patent also demonstrates how the spherical tire technology can be applied to robotic arms to enable large ranges of motion while being more energy efficient than traditional methods.

projects.name: Tidal energy generation method
projects.description: Working on mathematically developing an energy generation method to take advantage of tides. This method is similar to existing tidal barrages but can generate a nearly limitless amount of energy during low tide. This would be at the expense of an enormous capital cost.

projects.name: 4 Way Differential
projects.description: 3D printed a standard differential which is modified to accept one input and proportion torque to all 4 wheels of a vehicle via chain or belt drives. This system is meant to be used as a replacement for transfer cases and/or center differentials in AWD/4WD vehicles.

725073046.headline: Data Analyst | Business Analyst
725073046.summary: Welcome to my profile! I graduated from the University of Toronto, majored in Statistics and Computer Science. With one year of hands-on experience in the data industry, I've honed my skills as a data analyst, specializing in ETL, Machine learning methods, Python, SQL and quantitative analysis. Having moved to Toronto 11 years ago, I've gained a solid academic foundation and cultivated a deep understanding of the city's dynamic. I'm particularly passionate about problem-solving with machine learning and data analysis techniques, and I'm excited to apply my expertise in the data analysis field to find the root cause of any problems in the business, and tech domain. Let's connect and share our experiences in the thriving Toronto professional community! I am Proficient in Python, SQL, Java, and R, I possess a demonstrated ability to extract valuable insights from large and unstructured data sets. Additionally, I excel at data visualization and presentation, using Tableau, and BI tools to convey information effectively. I look forward to sharing my knowledge and working with you to achieve our data-related goals
